content.description: This simulating route starts with crux face moves off the ground, which is typical for this wall.  There is a low bolt to protect the crux, but a .75 camalot is nice to have ready for the upper crack.  Follow the now moderate finger crack to the well protected patina face climbing above.  A .3 camalot in an undercling will protect the runout between bolts.  A fun outing...
content.protection: Gear to .75 cam with medium to large nuts
content.location: The third route from the left.  It starts in one of the few vertical finger cracks on this wall.

content.description:
This line is only 5.10a after you reach the first jug.  At 6'4", you can just make the first move static.  After the first move, which is protected by a bolt,  follow fun patina face climbing protected by finger sized cams.  A couple bolts protect the middle section, but save a .75 camalot to protect the moves to the anchors.

This would be a 4 star route, except for the height dependent first move.
content.location: This is the third route from the right, but the second route which has some bolts.

content.description:
This route is technically on the east side of

Bumblie Rock

, but in the

Transformer Corridor

.  Starts in the chimney and is long with a chimney start that can be a bit tricky.  Lots of dishes and rounded knobs, and bolts, lots of bolts.  2 ropes for the rap.
content.protection: All Bolts and chain anchors.  Lts and lots of bolts!

content.description:
Located on the right side of the wall, start by climbing from the left side of the boulder to the right.  A direct start, while interesting involves strenuous laybacking to rounded holds and a mantle.  Work up the crack using jugs, small feet, and huacos.  Plan on placing extra gear to avoid hitting the ledge. Make strenuous and awkward moves left to gain a nice crack, poor feet on crumbly rock.  Climb up to the first bolt (at 30 feet) continuing on thin face to the final bolt. Move directly left to gain a crack and follow this around a bulge, placing gear and managing rope drag as you go.  Look right to locate the anchor above the bulge.

This route shares the anchors with

Short Circuit

to its left. The crux is the diagonal starting crack which is some what committing due to the poor feet. Follow a handful bolts and gear placements to chain anchors.
content.location: First bolted route from the right

content.description:
...Not such a pretty route.  Actually, it's not that bad, just a little dirty at the bottom.

Just a Pretty Day is the rightmost line on the main Transformer face, to the right of Live Wire.  It starts behind a tree in a shallow corner.  You can either stay in the corner the whole way (offwidth) or traverse left on knobs at 25 feet, up a short diagonal crack and then another traverse back right into the corner.  A good hand crack leads up to fingers through a bulge.
content.protection: Single set of cams, fingers through #4 camalot.  No fixed gear or anchors.  There's a small tree at the top of the formation you can rap off (haven't tried it but a 60m should work, bring your own tat and rap ring).  Or, traverse up and use one of the anchors on Vibrator or Heat Wave.

content.description:
This route starts about 10ft left of the finger crack on

Vibrator

.  Boulder up the the left leaning crack with small cams to the first bolt.  Follow four more bolts with 1 or 2 gear placements to the anchors.  The original route exited left in the leaning crack system.
content.location: The second route from the left.

content.description: Start with a bouldery crux directly below the first bolt and head straight up to the first bolt (easier variation: start ~7 feet right of the first bolt and traverse up and left to the first bolt). The crux comes just after the second bolt with thin sharp crimp moves. After this, the route eases off but stays interesting to the finish with great views of the East side of Flaming Rock.
content.location: On the left (north) end of the main Transformer Rock wall (east side), starting between 2 trees.

content.description: Located at the far end of the corridor on the left side.  Stem and boulder up chicken heads to reach a ledge below the first bolt.  Climb up right and reach left to clip the first bolt.  Make long moves up jugs and huecos to reach the second bolt.  Depending on your height and style climb left or directly up to the third bolt, first crux.  Climb 30-40 feet of crack and flakes to reach the 4th bolt, placing gear in the crack along the way.  Make technical and reachy moves between the 4th and 5th bolts, second crux to reach the anchor  Clip three bolts which follow nice patina edges then follow a small crack to two more bolts above which take you back to nice patina holds. A bit reachy here and there.
content.location:
This is technically on the

Bumblie Rock

east face, but sits inside the

Transformer Corridor

20 feet to the right of

Mystery Bolter

.
